title: Are there differences between staff groups reporting feeling pressure to work when unwell?
analysis_commentary: In line with staff reporting that they have been ill due to work related stress, the proportion of disabled staff who say that they felt pressure to attend work when ill is consistently greater than staff who are not disabled. In 2013, 37% of disabled staff said that they felt pressure to work compared to 23% of staff who are not disabled.
data_source: Department of Health, Survey of NHS Staff
